questions.text: During this festival in Sri Lanka, Buddha's tooth is carried around in a casket on an elephant's back. What is it called?
Which Hindu festival is the 'festival of nine nights'?
During which month of the Islamic calendar do Muslims not eat and drink during the daylight hours?
Which Jewish festival celebrates the Jewish exodus from Egypt?
questions.explanation:
Pesach.

	Pesach is also called Passover.

questions.text: The 'Id al-Adha' is the Islamic festival that celebrates what event?
questions.explanation:
End of the Hajj.

	In English you could refer to it as the 'feast of the sacrifice' or 'the major feast'.

questions.text: What is the major cultural festival of the Welsh speaking people of Wales?
questions.explanation:
Eisteddfod.

	Central to this festival is a poetry competition in which poets compete for the Crown and the Chair.

questions.text: What is the Sikh new year called?
The Japanese festival called 'Kodomono-hi' takes place every year on May 5th and celebrates what?
The Chinese Mid-Autumn Festival is also known as what?
questions.explanation:
Moon Festival.

	During this festival people eat traditional moon-shaped cakes. This holiday is a traditional one which celebrates a good Fall harvest.

questions.text: What is the fourth Sunday before Christmas called?
questions.explanation:
The First Sunday of Advent.

	Advent is the traditional first day of the Christian year and means 'coming'.
